intro: Paepalanthus arenicola, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and purple, typically blooming in spring. It is well adapted to sandy and well-drained soils, thriving in environments with limited water availability. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in xeriscaped gardens.
